SENT.plain: Mir-17-5p and mir-20a, members of the mir-17-92 family, down-regulate E2F1, which is over-expressed in myelodysplastic syndromes (MDS)
Moreover, let-7a down-regulates KRAS, which is aberrantly expressed in MDS
We evaluated the expression of the aforementioned microRNAs in CD34+ cells of 43 MDS patients using real-time PCR and their target proteins (E2F1, MYC, BCL2, CCND1, and KRAS) by Western blot
Mir-17-5p and mir-20a were under expressed in high risk MDS patients, compared to low risk MDS patients
Similarly, let-7a was under expressed in patients with intermediate or high-risk karyotype
Interestingly, there was an inverse correlation between microRNA and the expression levels of their targets
Importantly, mir-17-5p and mir-20a constitute favorable prognostic factors in MDS, since their expression was associated with increased overall survival of MDS patients
